channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: Top Tours of the Week — April 8 - 12, 2013
item.description:
From a design studio with a breathtaking view of the Manhattan bridge to a sunny, spacious San Francisco Victorian, this week's tours were all about spaciousness and color. There are lots of lessons here for making small spaces seem big, and making any space feel colorful and inviting. Come on in. 

• Workspace Tour: TODA's Panoramic View Design Studio
• House Tour: Brad & Julie's Sunny Modern Victorian
• Kids' Room Tour: Arden's White & Black Wonderland
• House Tour: Shell's Renovated Lofty Studio
• Kids' Room Tour: Sacha & Iris' Playful Sleep Space
• House Tour: Molly & Tyler's Classic Cool Cottage
• Workspace Tour: Ahoy! Pacific Helm's Happy Modern Office
• House Tour: Terri & Adam's Creatively Color-Coordinated Home
• House Tour: Anna & Ed's Modern & Historic Home
• Workspace Tour: Shayln's "Paint it Gold" Workspace

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Renovation Diary: What's New This Week — April 8 - 12, 2013
item.description:
We're on the home stretch! Seth and Allison got cabinets and countertops, Andi installed a kitchen island and a beautiful new light fixture, and Claire and Jeffrey installed subway tile in anticipation of the big reveal. 

• Seth & Allison's Kitchen: The Kitchen Comes Together
• Andi's Kitchen: The End is in Sight
• Claire & Jeffrey's Kitchen: A Few Indulgences

item.author: Carrie McBride

item.title: 3 Ways to Spruce Up Your Home with Paint — Apartment Therapy Video Roundup
item.description:
Here at Apartment Therapy, we're all about color, so in this week's video roundup we're bringing you three ways to add color to your home with a little bit of paint. These projects range in difficulty from 'super easy' to 'might take a few hours' to 'requires serious comitment,' so whether you're a seasoned DIYer or just looking to get your feet wet, there's something here for you. 

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: 7 Sources for Budget Outdoor Furniture
item.description:
So you want to create a little outdoor oasis but you're a little strapped for cash. Don't worry — it doesn't always take a lot of money to look like a million bucks. Here are seven sources for budget outdoor furniture to help you get started.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Get the Look: Gingham
item.description:
Yesterday we featured some inspiring uses of one of our favorite patterns: gingham. The word 'gingham' may bring to a mind a checkered tablecloth at a barbecue joint, but this simple, graphic pattern can also be surprisingly sophisticated. If you're looking to add a little gingham to your home, look no further than these picks from Apartment Therapy. 

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Light & Space: Michael Anastassiades' "String Light" for FLOS — I SALONI 2013
item.description:
Michael Anastassiades "String Light" for FLOS at Euroluce is elegant and interesting. It's about the space as much as it is about the light.

item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: The Home Office Music Rituals of Topo Designs — Lifework
item.description:
Unless you’ve been living under a Rocky Mountain, you’ve probably seen a lot of Topo Designs over the last year or two. Mark Hansen, along with fellow adventurer Jedd Rose, created the backpack and apparel company to satisfy their obsession for the perfect gear. Together they produce beguiling products, made in the United States, that hit the sweet spot between great aesthetics and smart functionality. Here’s the music Playlist that fills Mark’s workplace. Lend an ear.

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: Green Trend: Faceted Flower Pots
item.description:
Yes, this trend is still going strong, with geodesic planters found everywhere these days, from independent shops on Etsy to major retailers. Somewhere, Bucky Fuller is smiling down on us all.

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Shayln's "Paint it Gold" Workspace — Workspace Tour
item.description:
Name: Shalyn Nelson
Location: Austin, Texas
Size: 1,600 square feet (house)
Years lived in: 3 years

"When life gives you lemons, paint them gold." That's precisely what Shalyn did to create the workspace of her dreams in a home that needed some cheering up. Shalyn, a wedding photographer based in Austin, got creative with a limited budget to create an office every bit as bright as her beaming personality.

More
item.author: Chris Perez

item.title: The Weekend Guide: April 12, 2013 — National, Local & Online Sales & Events Calendar
item.description:
Spring seems to be taking its sweet time in getting started across much of the country. If you're feeling a little sluggish from this cold and rainy Spring, perhaps a little retail therapy is what you need. Check out all the sales and events in the Weekend Guide, pass it on and be sure to send us your own sale or event.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Menu For a Spring Housewarming Party
item.description:
Spring seems to be the season for moving. As soon as the books are on the shelves, and the forks are back in a drawer, it's time to invite the masses over to check out your new digs. 

• Spring Housewarming Menu
  The Kitchn
item.author: Cambria Bold

item.title: Superfront — Store Profile
item.description: We always love a good IKEA hack. And the coolest one right now comes straight out of Sweden: a new company called Superfront that livens up your basic IKEA kits with special cabinet fronts, sides, tops, handles, and legs for your Bestå sideboards and Pax wardrobes. More
item.author: Linda Ly

item.title: Garden Design Dilemmas: The Rectangular Urban Garden
item.description:
I have the quintessential urban backyard: compact, rectangular and narrow.  It's a very common layout for city homes, yet years ago when I was trying to decide on an arrangement for my backyard, I found very little help in the way of books, magazines, or websites. Fortunately, with the resurgence of the urban gardening and farming movement, there are now much better resources for design inspiration, which can help you avoid the pitfalls of a space with these constraints.
More
item.author: Kimber Watson

item.title: Design Q&A with Cliff Fong
item.description: If you received your copy of this month's Elle Decor, you've seen Cliff Fong's work; it's on the cover! His work has also appeared in Architectural Digest and Harper's Bazaar. Cliff, who'll be designing a window as part of this year's LCDQ (La Cienage Design Quarter) in Los Angeles, took a break to answer a few questions for me! More
item.author: Abby Stone

item.title: Will Mid-Century Modern Homes Kill Your Children? — Projectophile
item.description:
As a public service, Projectophile is alerting its readers to the dangers posed by key elements of mid-century modern residential design. Read on for their full alert.

More
item.author: Elisabeth Wilborn

item.title: Ms. Sanders' Project: Help With Gardening — Apartment Therapy + Donors Choose: Ready...Set...Grow!
item.description:
School: Roy Clark Elementary (High Poverty)
City: Tulsa, OK
Teacher: Ms. Sanders

Project: With your help, my students will be able to get out in nature and see how important it is for all of us to take care of nature and the world around us. We need seeds, soil and kits. As a bonus, they will see that learning can happen even when you are having fun.

→Donate to Ms. Sanders' students on Apartment Therapy's Donors Choose page.


More
item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: Is Your Smartphone Making You Less Creative? — Fast Company
item.description:
You know how it goes: you're waiting at the doctor's office... and catch up on your Facebook feed. You're in line at the grocery store... and scroll through a few Instagram shots. You're stuck in traffic... and send out a quick tweet to complain. While it seems our brains are always "on" with the daily thumbing and swiping on our screens, we're actually less stimulated than we think we are.

More
item.author: Linda Ly

item.title: Rings: 80th Anniversary Edition of a Design Classic — I Saloni 2013
item.description:
Nao Tamura's "Rings" is the 80th anniversary edition of Alvar Aalto's iconic stool.

item.author: Janel Laban

item.title: Living With Shared Outdoor Spaces
item.description:
As any city renter will tell you, any amount of outdoor space in an urban environment is a boon. While some are lucky enough to have their own private patio or, in rare cases, a whole yard, most outdoor spaces come with neighbors attached.

More
item.author: Kim Lucian
